selected_quotes: Interesting - from U Chicago, libertarian bastion, Eric Posner suggests antitrust action against investors.
Bold, thought-provoking proposal by @EricAPosner, Scott Morton and @glenweyl. Their @Slate piece started public debate on #co…
The first formal proposal on how to deal with the common ownership problem is out
This version of the PSW #commonownership paper addresses various questions left open in the first draft. Worth a read!…

news.title: Index-Fund Bans and Hedge-Fund Data
news.summary: How should index funds be illegal? We have talked before about the delightfully odd theory that ownership of multiple firms in the same industry by diversified mutual funds is an antitrust problem.

news.title: The man who transformed investing for Main Street sees a bleak future for Wall Street's money managers
news.summary: Vanguard John C. Bogle, 87, is the father of index investing, which allows anyone to invest in the market at very low cost — at such a low cost that traditional money managers trying to actively beat the markets are getting squeezed out.

news.title: Smart investors may be killing capitalism
